title: Benefit-Cost Reflection-Based Instructional Design Process for Integrating Digital Educational Tools

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Focuses on systematic reflection by in-service professionals on ethical/practical issues when using digital tools in math education, cultivating the ability to select tools tailored to individual educational contexts

learning_goals: Learners can specifically identify five or more ethical/practical issues that may arise when using digital educational tools
Learners can evaluate digital tools suitable for specific mathematics education scenarios with 80% accuracy using a benefit-cost reflection worksheet
Learners can design and implement three or more digital tool integration strategies tailored to their educational context through peer feedback and reflection

resources: Comparative Database for Digital Tools in Mathematics Education

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
